result.execSummary:
The defendant Khion M Martin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber for work release. DO NOT REPORT LATE OR UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF ALCOHOL OR CONTROLLED SUBSTANCES.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY REQUIRED.

Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Firearm warning given. Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Khion M Martin

records.addlTxt: Does not plan to seek postconviction relief.

11:15 AM Defendant Khion M Martin in court.  Attorney Addison R Kuhn in court for Khion M Martin.  Prosecuting attorney Dirk Christian Jensen in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter:  Nancy Szeklinski. 
Deft. to plea to Ct. 1.  State recommends 4 mos. RCJ.

PLEA: Ct. 1: G
BTC: Ct. 1: GUILTY.
Parties are willing to waive PSI and are prepared to proceed to sentencing.

BTC: Ct. 1: 4 mos. RCJ with Huber, 90 days CFTS., Huber for work release.  Report to RCJ on November 3, 2022 at 8:30 a.m.
Repay costs and surcharges at $50/month commencing December 2, 2022.  FTP will results in a civil judgment or 4 days RCJ.
FAW/VOTE.
DNA sample.

and Summary of Expert testimony of Law Enforcement Officer and/or Analyst, by the State.

***ALSO $1,000.00 SIGNATURE BOND*** Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.

1:55 PM Prosecuting attorney Matthew W Kline in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Khion M Martin appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney McKenna Marie Quinter appeared by video for Khion M Martin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 4, 2022 at 09:00 am.
